title: [E0532] Error when using functions in patterns should give an explanation of patterns

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

labels.name: A-patterns
labels.description: Relating to patterns and pattern matching

body:
Given the following code: [(Playground)](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=d0c78b010de0962788843dd4bbd4ca07)

```rust
fn main() {
    let (x, drop(y)) = (1, 2);
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0532]: expected tuple struct or tuple variant, found function `drop`
 --> src/main.rs:2:13
  |
2 |     let (x, drop(y)) = (1, 2);
  |             ^^^^ not a tuple struct or tuple variant
```

The error message should give/link to an explanation of what kinds of things are expected in patterns in general, maybe in a note.

([Filed at request of](https://twitter.com/ekuber/status/1527436099924111360) @estebank)
